metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3550 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability classified as critical was found in X.org Server. Affectedby this vulnerability is the function _GetCountedString of the filexkb/xkb.c. The manipulation leads to buffer overflow. It is recommended toapply a patch to fix this issue. The associated identifier of thisvulnerability is VDB-211051.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3550` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xnest - 2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1
xorg-server-source - 2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1
xserver-common - 2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1
xserver-xephyr - 2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1
xserver-xorg-core - 2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1
xvfb - 2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

xwayland - 2:22.1.5-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1').
xwayland package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:22.1.5-1').
